title: What are Garen & Darius in relation to Riven & Yasuo in the VS universe?

replies.body: so correct me if wrong , Would it be Wrong to say that Nightbringer and Dawnbringer are the strongest beings in leagueverse ?

> [{quoted}](name=DemonRyu,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8wEL6vrT,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-07-11T01:23:28.760+0000)
>
> so correct me if wrong , Would it be Wrong to say that Nightbringer and Dawnbringer are the strongest beings in leagueverse ?

In the entire League multiverse? I would personally put the Dark Star as the single strongest entity across all our canons. Maybe some of the other writers will disagree, but a sentient singularity that mindlessly erases existence _just by being there_, while pooping out matter-devouring eldritch gods, is probably the thing you least want to deal with on some random Tuesday. It also can exist outside reality, which is... not good, if you happen to be part of one.

Close runners up are the Nightbringer and Dawnbringer, the Blood Moon (which is sentient), and Cosmic Kassadin (who hangs out watching universes live, die, and be born again). I can't comment on the core IP because I'm not entirely sure who sits where. I know the Watchers are pretty high up there.

Oh, and Little Devil Teemo is, ironically, also one of the most powerful entities across all of League. So sit back and marinate on that waking nightmare.

If Dark Star is now the single strongest entity in League of Legends multiverse, stronger than Blood Moon itself even, does that mean it and its champions can time travel as well like the Blood Moons (and also Pulsefire)?

Blood Moon Zilean is still accessing _linear_ time. The Dark Star and its corruptants don't understand time as a linear thing, but rather as an outmoded tool of measurement for living organisms that must be destroyed.
This needs all the visibility it can get

Lies, Final Boss Veigar is the most powerfull character... because, after all... the champions are nothing more than miserable piles of pixels and he can delete them from the game. He knows that Dark stars, Watchers and everything in between are only a bunch of zeros and ones in a game... a game were he is quite literally: The Final Boss
This is gold!

 Well , i said Nightbringer and Dawnbringer as they were the first beings that came into existence , but good to know they are close runner ups, completely forgot about the dark star.
Uhhh i didn't know Blood Moon was an actual Being in itself that is really awesome !! i want to know more about that ! 
Oh please , teemo, hell no ^^

> [{quoted}](name=DemonRyu,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8wEL6vrT,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2018-07-11T02:10:17.751+0000)
>

> Uhhh i didn't know Blood Moon was an actual Being in itself that is really awesome !! i want to know more about that ! 
> Oh please , teemo, hell no ^^

the problem is that you compare multiple Storys.
every skin line has their own canon and lore, its like comparing Mikey mouse with cinderella so to speak.

- nightbringer and dawnbringer were the first beings that came to existence in their Storys universe.
- the dark star is a multidimensional entity that existed before its story universe happened
- in league of legends main canon, currently prob the strongest ''thing'' is illaois god, which is a universal truth that also exists outside a single realm of existence 
- arclight is also a godlike entity but in its own story universe

> [{quoted}](name=Ataraxas,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8wEL6vrT,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-07-09T23:16:07.114+0000)
>
> I&#039;m curious. :)

Garen and Darius are far-flung, deific descendants of the original cosmic entities, Riven and Yasuo. They're actually the _last_ two descendants, making their war the end of their own universe's mythology. Both have become mortal (to a small degree), and have perhaps... twisted their ancestors' original purposes to suit more personal needs. But they still recognize them, as shown in their special interactions.

> [{quoted}](name=Carnival Knights,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8wEL6vrT,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-07-10T21:29:25.209+0000)
>
> Garen and Darius are far-flung, deific descendants of the original cosmic entities, Riven and Yasuo. They're actually the _last_ two descendants, making their war the end of their own universe's mythology. Both have become mortal (to a small degree), and have perhaps... twisted their ancestors' original purposes to suit more personal needs. But they still recognize them, as shown in their special interactions.

Wait so who did Riven & Yasuo have kids with? Were they not the very first two beings in the VS universe? And also did Yasuo's victory mean nothing? How did Order live on and Garen rise up as an equal to Darius after the Yasuo ended Order at its source and brought complete chaos to the universe? Thanks for the reply by the way. :)

Edit: Do them being the last mean their battle is end all be all? No more order vs chaos after them? Also how strong are Garen and Darius compared to Riven and Yasuo? Did they get weaker or stronger over time? Also do Riven and Yasuo still exist during the time of Garen and Darius or did they die? If so, how did the primordial beings die? And if they are not alive are the in-game interactions not cannon? And if they are alive do they help eachother? Have a four way war? Not care? Sorry for so many questions but I'm really a fan of events with multiple sides such as this. x)

Also I'm guessing from what you said the next VS event (if there is one) won't be order vs chaos but rather something else. Unless you guys decide to do one with the timeline being in between Riven & Yasuo and Garen & Darius.

I would like to know the answers to these questions !!

> ...and have perhaps... twisted their ancestors' original purposes to suit more personal needs.

So that explains why Garen and Darius feel detached from their roots of Order and Chaos. I've always kind of wondered why Garen was totalitarian tyranny compared to Riven's welcoming absolution.

Now, to understand what personal needs Garen and Darius were trying to fulfil by twisting the purposes of Chaos and Order. Questions, questions...

I like this, maybe throw reincarnation into the mix. 

I also love to see Irelia vs. swain next year. And can they be switched, darkside for irelia and lightside for swain?

Swain is Irelia's direct Rival since their recent VGUs more so than Syndra is.

She cut off his arm and he invaded and fdefiled her homeland leading to her families death.

Besides{{champion:238}} and {{champion:98}} that's probably the most direct rivalry in league that hasn't been in a VS event
uhh, {{champion:236}} vs {{champion:412}} ?
that never happened unless i somehow forgot about it
You included Kled.  I am pleased.
These are good rivalries, but some of them don't fit the theme well.  Who would be order and who chaos between rengar and kha?  Between jayce and Viktor?

Jayce and Viktor are fairly easy in my opinion.
Jayce in the lore already sees himself as a righteous hero, protecting the people of Piltover (-> Order).

Meanwhile Viktor wants to improve humanity with his own idea of the Glorious Evolution, which many people see as amoralic. But he thinks that everyone should have the right to decide himself, if they want to participate (-> Chaos).

_________________

About Kha and Rengar:
I would put Rengar as Order, since his goal in the lore is to gain respect by being the best hunter in the world.

Kha just wants to grow stronger himself for the sake of it by consuming everything, so he would fit Chaos IMO.

> [{quoted}](name=mrmeddyman,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=8wEL6vrT,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-07-10T00:37:06.347+0000)
>

> 
> She cut off his arm and he invaded and fdefiled her homeland leading to her families death.
> 
> Besides{{champion:238}} and {{champion:98}} that's probably the most direct rivalry in league that hasn't been in a VS event

Even {{champion:268}} vs {{champion:101}} would work, cause Xerath brought down Azir's empire and according to the OG Azir lore, Xerath also killed Azir's son and pregnant wife.
But who would be order and who would be chaos in the case of swain and irelia?  I would classify swain as, on the balance, a good guy

It's not so much about good and evil, God-King Garen is a tyrannical ruler who enforce Order at any cost even smiting his own followers if he detects dissent among them.

Swain would be Order but he wouldn't be "good"
Irelia would be Chaos (she is a freedom fighter after all), but she isn't "evil"

Well {{champion:122}}  calls {{champion:157}}  his predecessor in quote " I challenge you predecessor!" and {{champion:86}}  calls {{champion:157}}  "ancient evil" so I would guess {{champion:92}} and{{champion:157}} battle happen long before {{champion:122}} and{{champion:86}}.

This was also very interesting to me but yea I am 100% sure every VS event we will see will be one after other, let's say next year will be {{champion:98}} VS{{champion:238}}  it will be after war between {{champion:122}} and{{champion:86}}

Well {{champion:92}} vs {{champion:157}} had this "in a time long forgotten" vibe to it where these two primordial forces did battle just because they were polar opposites.

Then {{champion:86}} vs {{champion:122}} happens and it's clearly a more medieval time because they have amassed followers that swear fealty to each side.

If time is passing wouldn't it be interesting to get {{champion:126}} vs {{champion:112}} as a futuristic theme to sell that passage of time and really drive home the point that even in an Industrial Age/ Steampunk world this endless conflict between Order and Chaos is still raging?

In reality {{champion:126}} and {{champion:112}} do not have the loyal player bases that {{champion:122}}, {{champion:92}} and {{champion:157}} have OR aren't beginner champs that everyone has access to like {{champion:86}}.

People seem to be calling for {{champion:98}} vs {{champion:238}} 2019 more than anything which I think is a cool idea. Neither of them have legendaries, they both have healthy play rates and Zed especially has a committed player base plus it would be cool to see a more dispassionate side to Order with Shen's indifference plus Zed's newest lore makes him seem more chaotic neutral then the devil he was before lore updates so he would make a more nuanced chaos champ.

Probably Riot's best bet

> People seem to be calling for {{champion:98}} vs {{champion:238}} 2019 more than anything which I think is a cool idea. Neither of them have legendaries, they both have healthy play rates and Zed especially has a committed player base plus it would be cool to see a more dispassionate side to Order with Shen's indifference plus Zed's newest lore makes him seem more chaotic neutral then the devil he was before lore updates so he would make a more nuanced chaos champ.

As cool as Zed Vs Shen would be it seems like with all these comments are forgetting one of the biggest champion vs champion potential. {{champion:89}} vs {{champion:131}}
Also one theory is that every few generations, 2 spirits enter certain 2 champions, one seeks order and one chaos, one peace, one war just like we saw these past 2 events.
Yeah that's what I kinda assumed, that they're basically reincarnations of the two spirits, Chaos & Order.

They are embodiments of the spirit of Order and Chaos. Riven and Yasuo were the first ones from what we saw. It was like they were fighting in a big emptiness. Space ¿ maybe they were the first thing to pop into existence in that universe ¿

{{champion:10}} and {{champion:25}} are literally angels.

theyre porbably next imo. especially since theyre up for a shared VGU and didnt get a skin in quite a while. does morgana even have a legendary as one of the og champions? heck, they might actually become the canon law vs. chaos spirits with their base skins reworked to look like them.
